amendatorysection.catchline: Actions; intervention; waiver of service; confession of judgment; power of city attorney.
amendatorysection.para: The city attorney of a city of the metropolitan class shall have the power to:
(1) Intervene in any suit or proceeding when the rights of the city are involved or where the city is a proper party;
(2) Waive the issuance and service of summons and may enter a voluntary appearance when in the city attorney's opinion the interests of the city may require it; and
(3) Confess judgment, but only when authorized by the city council.

annotation.para: Nebraska private citizens cannot maintain action under Clayton Act for alleged injury to municipality arising from alleged Sherman Act violations. Cosentino v. Carver-Greenfield Corp., 433 F.2d 1274 (8th Cir. 1970).
